Sentencas: The application of nano-electrocatalysts to solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) provides opportunities to enhance performance.
Titulo: Nanoscale cathode modification for high performance and stable low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs)

Sentencas: However, due to high sintering and operating temperature of SOFCs, nanostructured electrodes tend to agglomerate, losing its high surface area and catalytic activity.
Titulo: Nanoscale cathode modification for high performance and stable low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs)

Sentencas: Here we report a high performance, surface modified La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-d-Ce0.9Gd0.1O2-d (LSCF-GDC) cathode for low-temperature SOFCs, prepared by solution infiltration.
Titulo: Nanoscale cathode modification for high performance and stable low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs)

Sentencas: By carefully co-controlling the low calcination and operating temperature (< 650 degrees C), the growth of infiltrated nano-particles is impeded and the oxygen reduction reaction (ORR) is activated.
Titulo: Nanoscale cathode modification for high performance and stable low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs)

Sentencas: Using isotopic exchange, we show that these nano-electrocatalysts significantly decreases the apparent activation energy for oxygen dissociation, leading to high intrinsic catalytic activity in addition to high surface area.
Titulo: Nanoscale cathode modification for high performance and stable low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs)

Sentencas: Consequently, maximum power densities of the modified SOFCs are two times higher than pristine cells.
Titulo: Nanoscale cathode modification for high performance and stable low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs)

Sentencas: Moreover, we demonstrate these nanoelectrocatalysts remain highly active over 1300 h at 600 degrees C and exhibit exceptional stability under transient current loads, an essential feature for portable and automotive applications.
Titulo: Nanoscale cathode modification for high performance and stable low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs)

Sentencas: Our results highlight a simple method to dramatically improve the performance and stability of low-temperature operating SOFCs by retaining nanoscale electrocatalysts (< 10 nm) being active toward the ORR.
Titulo: Nanoscale cathode modification for high performance and stable low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs)
